name: Conceptualization
desc: Ideas; formulation or evolution of overarching research goals and aims.

name: Data curation
desc: Management activities to annotate (produce metadata), scrub data and maintain research data (including software code, where it is necessary for interpreting the data itself) for initial use and later re-use.

name: Formal analysis
desc: Application of statistical, mathematical, computational, or other formal techniques to analyze or synthesize study data.

name: Funding acquisition
desc: Acquisition of the financial support for the project leading to this publication.

name: Investigation
desc: Conducting a research and investigation process, specifically performing the experiments, or data/evidence collection.

name: Methodology
desc: Development or design of methodology; creation of models.

name: Project administration
desc: Management and coordination responsibility for the research activity planning and execution.

name: Resources
desc: Provision of study materials, reagents, materials, patients, laboratory samples, animals, instrumentation, computing resources, or other analysis tools.

name: Software
desc: Programming, software development; designing computer programs; implementation of the computer code and supporting algorithms; testing of existing code components.

name: Supervision
desc: Oversight and leadership responsibility for the research activity planning and execution, including mentorship external to the core team.

name: Validation
desc: Verification, whether as a part of the activity or separate, of the overall replication/reproducibility of results/experiments and other research outputs.

name: Visualization
desc: Preparation, creation and/or presentation of the published work, specifically visualization/data presentation.

name: Writing – original draft
desc: Preparation, creation and/or presentation of the published work, specifically writing the initial draft (including substantive translation).

name: Writing – review & editing
desc: Preparation, creation and/or presentation of the published work by those from the original research group, specifically critical review, commentary or revision – including pre- or post-publication stages.
